intro: Barleria prionitoides subsp. strigulosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in open grasslands and rocky soils. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or red. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions. The subspecies strigulosa is distinguished by its finely hairy stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive texture.
